revised_title: Electronic Properties of Alkali Metal Intercalates Derived from Graphite
tldr: The authors studied the electronic properties of synthetic metals derived from graphite, specifically focusing on alkali metal intercalates with the approximate composition C8K, C8Rb, and C8Cs. They found that these materials exhibit n-type behavior as metallic conductors, with carbon-hexagon networks acting as macro-anions. The temperature coefficient of electrical resistance was measured for these materials, providing insights into their electronic properties and confirming their metallic conductor nature.
